title: Why can't the eye see around corners? - Quora

response.answer_text: This has nothing to do with our eyes. It has to do with the characteristics of light.Light goes in straight lines, if not being reflected by a mirror or bendt by a prism. Due to this, we can not see around corners because then the light would have to bend around corners. And light does not do that.

We see things because the light that reflects of these things enter our eyes. We can’t something behind a corner, because it is obscured from our view. Light doesn’t bend around corners, so we don’t see it.
